hotspots.label: Green Chrysalis
hotspots.fact: This green chrysalis is the pupal stage of a butterfly or moth. Inside this protective shell, an amazing transformation called metamorphosis is happening! The caterpillar's body is completely reorganizing into a beautiful winged insect.

hotspots.label: Shed Skin
hotspots.fact: This tan, papery structure is the old skin the caterpillar shed before forming its chrysalis. Caterpillars have to shed their skin several times as they grow because their skin doesn't stretch! This leftover skin is called an exoskeleton.

hotspots.label: Brick Wall Surface
hotspots.fact: This butterfly chose a safe spot on a brick wall to create its chrysalis. Many insects select sheltered locations like walls, plants, or under eaves to protect themselves while they transform. Safety from predators is very important during this vulnerable stage!
